title: Grilled Scallop Salad
introduction: Large, plump sea scallops are delicious grilled and served on a bed of tender salad greens and tomatoes. Inspired by a dish from I Trulli Restaurant and Enoteca in New York, this salad can be enjoyed all year round by using a grill pan.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 large ripe tomatoes, cut into bite-size pieces
6 cups tender salad greens, torn into bite-size pieces
instructions: Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat until a drop of water sizzles when dropped on the surface. Brush the pan lightly with oil.

Pat the scallops dry and place them on the grill pan. Cook until the scallops are lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Turn the scallops and cook until browned and slightly translucent in the center, 1 to 2 minutes more.
In a large bowl, whisk together the lemon juice with 3 tablespoons oil. Add the scallops and toss well. Let stand 5 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Add the herbs and tomatoes to the scallops and stir gently.
Arrange the lettuce on serving plates. Top with the scallop mixture and serve immediately.
